alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Jefferson; Lyon; Osage; Shawnee; Wabaunsee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 04 at 8:41PM CDT until April 04 at 9:30PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: The National Weather Service in Topeka has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Jefferson County in northeastern Kansas... Shawnee County in east central Kansas... Northwestern Douglas County in east central Kansas... Southeastern Wabaunsee County in east central Kansas... Northern Osage County in east central Kansas... Northeastern Lyon County in east central Kansas... * Until 930 PM CDT. * At 840 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Meriden to near Pauline to near Admire, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Topeka, Carbondale, Oskaloosa, Tecumseh, Richland, Auburn, Overbrook, Burlingame, Perry, McLouth, Meriden, Scranton, Lecompton, Harveyville, Admire, Pauline, Williamstown, Perry Lake, Grantville and Berryton. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 between mile markers 353 and 355. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 147 and 198. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Douglas; Jefferson; Lyon; Osage; Shawnee; Wabaunsee
